intro: Hieracium villosiceps subsp. schleicheri, commonly known as the Schleicher's hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and basal leaves, which are often covered in fine, white to grayish pubescence. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, typical of the genus Hieracium. It is native to Central Europe and thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Due to its specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and locally distributed species.
